topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5581ff4d63687279a2001065#post_5581ff4d63687279a2001065
!https://com360bu.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/pokemon-games-chart.png!

Don't take this the wrong way pokemon fans and while I don't like pokemon I'm speaking purely sales wise; the pokemon franchise is starting to slow down sales wise.  There are individual games that are doing well, but the over all trend is showing a slow decline.  The games are still doing well, *BUT* it definitely is slowing down.

Tl:dr; pokemon has a good ten years left in it.

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5582012b636872346e00000a#post_5582012b636872346e00000a
Just a bit of guessing, but looking at the sales per games over the years; pokemon is about only a third of how popular it was.  It's not going to die for at least another ten years.

The *average* number of units that have to be sold for a AAA game in order for it to remain profitably is around the 5 million products sold margin currently, but taking into account the declining cost of games and how games are moving towards digital downloads thus reducing costs ten years is a fair estimate.
